channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Officials Try to Advance Israel’s Cease-Fire Talks With Hezbollah and Hamas
item.description: William Burns, the C.I.A. director, is making a last-ditch attempt to move Gaza talks along before U.S. elections next week.

item.title: How the U.S. Election Matters for the Rest of the World
item.description: Times foreign correspondents describe what’s at stake for the world, including China, Israel, Ukraine, global trade and climate.

item.title: What Sank the Bayesian Superyacht in Italy?
item.description: A Times investigation has found that an unusually tall mast, and the design changes it required, made a superyacht owned by a British tech mogul vulne...

item.title: Ikea pledges €6 million to former prisoners of communist East Germany who were forced to build flat-pack furniture during the Cold War
item.description: “We deeply regret that this happened,” said Walter Kadnar, CEO of Ikea Germany.

item.title: The Fed’s Preferred Inflation Gauge Cooled Overall in September
item.description: Overall inflation slowed in September from a year earlier, though some signs of stubbornness lingered under the surface.

item.title: After Flash Floods in Spain, Rescuers and Residents Face a Grim Scene
item.description: At least 95 people have died, and others are still missing, though how many remains unclear. Rescuers feared finding more bodies, the defense minister...

item.title: ‘Witches’ Marks’? Curses? Medieval Etchings Uncovered at Manor House
item.description: A discovery of etched symbols and writing at a British Manor House has experts examining their possible meaning.

item.title: Google Maps just got a fresh injection of AI features—here’s what you can do now
item.description: “We are entering a new era of maps,” Google Maps general manager Miriam Daniel said.

item.title: In Georgia, Harris Supporters Pull Together and Fight the Odds
item.description: It’s not easy being a dot of blue in Trump country.

item.title: Election warning: Zelle CEO says elderly Americans and their families need to be on ‘heightened state of alert’ against scams
item.description: With reports of elderly victims of political scammers on the rise, the payment giant that transacted $481 million in he first half of 2024, says famil...

item.title: After Flash Floods in Spain, Rescuers and Residents Face a Grim Scene
item.description: At least 95 people have died, and others are still missing, though how many remains unclear. Rescuers feared finding more bodies, the defense minister...

item.title: A Fiery Bernie Sanders Courts Blue-Collar Voters
item.description: The Vermont senator’s appearances on the trail to support Vice President Kamala Harris stand in stark contrast to her optimistic message.

item.title: Two years ago, world leaders established a global Pandemic Fund. Now its co-chairs are warning it needs at least $2 billion by June
item.description: Due to the high demand in many countries, the Pandemic Fund will exhaust most of its funds by next June.

item.title: Typhoon Kong-rey Lashes Taiwan With Powerful Winds and Rain
item.description: The storm was the most powerful tropical cyclone to hit Taiwan in nearly 30 years, the government said. At least one person was killed on Thursday.

item.title: COVID-19 is no longer the world’s leading infectious disease killer
item.description: A longtime leading killer retakes the lead.
